column2: NV DRIVERS LICENSE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
column8: even if they are short sighted.

column2: 2. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a sharp turn.

column2: 3. Work zone signs:
column4: mean that drivers must come to a complete stop and back up.
column6: mean that drivers should drive faster to get out of the work zone.
column8: mean that road conditions will improve soon.
column10: provide information on road work or other temporary road conditions.

column2: 4. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.
column8: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.

column2: 5. This sign means:
column8: The traffic signal ahead is out of order
column10: you must yield to the traffic signal ahead.

column2: 6. This sign means:
column8: No parking on pavement.

column2: 7. If you are pulled over by law enforcement, you should:
column4: unbuckle your seat belt and lower your window.
column6: get out of your vehicle and walk toward the patrol car.
column8: stay in the driver’s seat with both hands clearly in sight on the steering wheel.
column10: turn off on your interior light if stopped at night.

column2: 8. Regulatory signs are:
column8: Warnings

column2: 9. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car that is traveling faster.
column6: The car approaching from the left.
column8: The car approaching from the right.
column10: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.

column2: 10. Air bags are meant to _________ seat belts.
column8: work with

column2: 11. Keeping a space cushion between you and the other vehicles around you is important because it:
column6: keeps traffic flowing at a safe pace.
column8: prevents distractions from other vehicles.
column10: gives you time to react to situations.

column2: 12. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column6: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column8: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column10: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 13. Motorcycle operators have the right to:
column4: share a traffic lane with a vehicle.
column6: travel faster than other vehicles on the road.
column8: use a complete traffic lane.
column10: use the shoulder of a roadway.

column2: 14. This sign means:
column8: narrow bridge ahead.

column2: 15. When they see this sign, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed and keep well to the right.
column8: slow down and keep well to the left.
column10: slow down and keep well to the right.

column2: 16. What is the first thing you should do if your wheels move off the pavement?
column4: Try pumping the gas pedal to increase pressure.
column8: Pull over to the right and sound your horn to warn the other drivers.
column10: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column4: Traffic is entering from another road, drive with caution
column8: Stop for other traffic

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: Stay on the main highway if possible
column8: The road to the right is for one-way traffic only

column2: 19. Before turning, you should:
column6: sound your horn to alert the other drivers.
column8: give the proper turn signal.

column2: 20. Pentagonal signs are used to indicate:
column8: no passing zones.

column2: 21. Most signs used in street work areas are:
column8: rectangle shaped.

column2: 22. You are driving in the left lane and want to change to the right lane. Before changing lanes, you should check your mirrors, signal and:
column8: accelerate slightly before looking around your vehicle.
column10: look over both shoulders for vehicles in front of you.

column2: 23. This sign warns that:
column6: the bridge ahead is wide enough for only one vehicle at a time.
column8: traffic must merge right.

column2: 24. The amount of space you need to cross traffic depends on the:
column6: road and weather conditions and oncoming traffic.
column8: number of cars behind you.
column10: number of cars in front of you.

column2: 25. This road sign means:
column8: Divided highway ahead - stay to the right

column2: 26. This road sign means:
column6: Cars in right lane must slow down
column8: Merging traffic ahead
column10: Pass only in the right lane

column2: 27. Vertical rectangles tell drivers:
column4: that there's a school zone ahead.
column8: the law.

column2: 28. This sign indicates:
column8: The road may be slippery when wet. Drive slowly.
column10: Double curve ahead. Slow your speed.

column2: 29. A flashing yellow light:
column4: can be found before reaching a sharp curve.
column8: warns drivers to proceed with caution.

column2: 30. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column8: in the opposite direction of the skid.
column10: in the direction you want to go.

column2: 31. What is the meaning of blue traffic signs?
column8: Blue indicates pedestrian crossings and school zones.
column10: A blue background indicates a regulatory sign.

column2: 32. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: make a U-turn and return to the expressway.
column10: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.

column2: 33. This traffic sign warns you about:
column4: a hill or a downgrade up ahead on the road.
column8: a winding road.

column2: 34. Passing is prohibited:
column4: when a school bus is stopped to load or unload children on a public road.
column6: whenever a solid line marks the left side of your lane.
column8: at intersections.

column2: 35. When other drivers around you are acting in anger, you should:
column8: slow down or move over safely.

column2: 36. If you hear a thumping sound while driving, you should:
column4: get off the road and check your tires.
column8: hook your shoe under the gas pedal and see if you can free it.

column2: 37. ________ are your best protection against injury or death if you are in a vehicle crash.
column8: Timely crash reports

column2: 38. Green and white signs:
column4: warn drivers of unexpected road conditions.
column6: give information about directions and distances.
column8: are mainly used at intersections and driveways.

column2: 39. You may use a center turn lane:
column4: to make a left turn onto or from the highway.
column6: to make a right turn onto or from the highway.
column8: to pass other vehicles.

column2: 40. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column6: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 41. A flashing red light:
column4: means that you must bring your vehicle to a complete halt.
column8: means the same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 42. This sign indicates that:
column4: the highest safe speed drivers should travel around the curve ahead is 25 MPH.
column6: there is a school zone after the curve.
column8: the safe speed around the curve ahead is at least 25 MPH.
column10: drivers may not turn right if traveling at 25 MPH or less.

column2: 43. Drivers are required to yield to pedestrians in a crosswalk.
44. The picture shows a _________ sign.
column8: no U-turn

column2: 45. An edge line that angles toward the center of the road indicates that:
column8: you must turn right.

column2: 46. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 47. On average, how long does it take your body to remove the alcohol contained in 5 ounces of wine?
column8: 3 hours.

column2: 48. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column6: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.
column8: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column10: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.

column2: 49. This sign means:
column8: Railroad crossing

column2: 50. A flashing red light means:
column6: Go, but yield the right-of-way to other traffic at the intersection.
column8: The light will soon change to steady red.
column10: The same as a STOP sign.
